event.title: January 1884 when a plan of survey for the subdivision of land owned

data.event: The general area was known as Peat's Ferry crossing for a long time until January 1884 when a plan of survey for the subdivision of land owned by Peter and William Fagan was registered with the suburb name of Brooklyn.
A hotel of the same name followed later in the year.

event.title: 1887 when the single track section north from Hornsby was completed

data.event: The town owes its existence and location to the main northern railway line with the railway arriving in Brooklyn in 1887 when the single track section north from Hornsby was completed.
